Posts.Content: Hi there Yes I'm on FEC-T, seems like the same then .... after the first Docetexal caught an infection which lead to the sepsis. I was admitted for 4 days with IV antibotics but his time I have had a reduced dose of 75% and apart from being exhausted and achy seems to be abit better. Apart from very emotional getting there slowly. Is it normal to cry at anything!!! Thanks for your response xx
Posts.Title: Ductal breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi there I have been diagnosed with ductal breast cancer. I have had the lump removed and currently having chemo...bit rubbish as was admitted to hospital with sepsis after the last chemo so worried it may happen again.  Anyone else been the same? New to this...but thanks x
Posts.Title: Ductal breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi there thanks for replying x I had SNB in May too and clear margins, started FEC-T mid June time. The first 3 rounds were manageable but when I had the first round of Docetexal ended up with sepsis. Everyone is different I know ..had the 5th dose Monday just gone which was a reduced dose of 75 % and been exhausted and a few aches and pains but so far so good. Been an emotional wreck today though.... thank God my k husband and kids love me as I have been a horror! Keep me updated on you,  sending hugs x
Posts.Title: Ductal breast cancer

Posts.Content: Yes 1 more remaining on 1st October.. dreading it but there is light at the end of the tunnel!  Think my husband deserves a medal for putting up with me Its an emotional roller coaster.... Cannot wait to taste food property and get rid of the horrid taste in my mouth....oh and my hair to grow back!!! Speak soon xxx
Posts.Title: Ductal breast cancer
